# Remove /etc/profile.d files in favor of loadable modules when available
if test -f /etc/profile.d/pgi.sh; then
/bin/rm -f /etc/profile.d/pgi.*
# Make sure modules package reads modulefiles from /opt/modulefiles/compilers line='setenv MODULEPATH /opt/modulefiles/compilers:$MODULEPATH' if test `grep -Fc "$line" /etc/profile.d/modules.csh` = 0; then echo "$line" >> /etc/profile.d/modules.csh fi line='export MODULEPATH=/opt/modulefiles/compilers:$MODULEPATH' if test `grep -Fc "$line" /etc/profile.d/modules.sh` = 0; then echo "$line" >> /etc/profile.d/modules.sh fi
# Add module files for the PGI compilers /bin/mkdir -m 0755 -p /opt/modulefiles/compilers/pgi
#%Module1.0 module-whatis "PGI compilers" module-whatis "Version: 11.9" module-whatis "Description: PGI compilers (C/C++/Fortran)"
# If unloading, also unload any pgi-dependent modules if {[module-info mode switch1] || [module-info mode switch3]} { # Get the command line that invoked this process; unload only if switching # from pgi to another (compiler) module, e.g., "module switch pgi gnu" set commandWords [split [exec /bin/ps -p [pid] -o args=] " "] set switchFrom [lindex [split [module-info name] "/"] 0] set switchTo [lindex [split [lindex $commandWords end] "/"] 0] set unloadApps [expr ! [string equal $switchTo $switchFrom]] } elseif {[module-info mode remove]} { set unloadApps 1 } else { set unloadApps 0 } if {$unloadApps && [info exists env(LOADEDMODULES)]} { foreach app [split $env(LOADEDMODULES) ":"] { # Check whether any pgi-dependent module dir contains a module w/this name if {[llength [glob -nocomplain /opt/modulefiles/*/.pgi/$app]] > 0} { puts stderr "Unloading compiler-dependent module $app" module unload [lindex [split $app "/"] 0] } } }
# Add all pgi-dependent module dirs to the search path foreach path [glob -nocomplain /opt/modulefiles/*/.pgi] { prepend-path MODULEPATH $path }
# Compiler environment modifications prepend-path PATH "/opt/pgi/linux86-64/11.9/bin" prepend-path LD_LIBRARY_PATH "/opt/pgi/linux86-64/11.9/libso"
#%Module1.0 set ModulesVersion "11.9"
/bin/ln -s /opt/modulefiles/compilers/pgi/.version.11.9 \ /opt/modulefiles/compilers/pgi/.version
fi
